frontmatter.title: R: Create Empty Plots
frontmatter.excerpt: How to create empty plots in R...

pageProps.content: ## Do you know you can create empty plots in R? Sometimes, you just want to create an empty plot in R... Just want to remove everything? [â†“â†“ TLDR â†“â†“](#tldr). ## The good old _plot_ command First, let get ourselves some data. ```{r} set.seed(42) y1 <- rnorm(10) x1 <- seq_along(y1) ``` ### A Typical Plot Plotting it in a normal way: ```{r} plot(x1, y1) ``` ![A typical plot](/images/blogs/create-empty-rplot_normal-plot.png) ### Remove the labels (and titles) The obvious way ```{r} plot( x1, y1, xlab = "", ylab = "", main = "" ) ``` An alternative way ```{r} plot( x1, y1, xlab = "Oh no I'm gone", ylab = "Oh no I'm gone", ann = FALSE # <- added this ) ``` ![A plot with labels removed](/images/blogs/create-empty-rplot_remove-labels.png) ### Remove some ticks ```{r} plot( x1, y1, xaxt = "n", # suppress x-ticks yaxt = "n" # suppress y-ticks ) ``` ![A plot with ticks removed](/images/blogs/create-empty-rplot_remove-ticks.png) ### Remove the points ```{r} plot(x1, y1, col = rgb(0, 0, 0, 0)) # Set alpha to 0 ``` ![A plot with invisible points](/images/blogs/create-empty-rplot_remove-points.png) ### Remove surrounding box ```{r} plot(x1, y1, fg = rgb(0, 0, 0, 0)) # Set alpha to 0 ``` ![A plot with invisible box](/images/blogs/create-empty-rplot_remove-box.png) ### Remove everything!? (Part 1) ```{r} plot( x1, y1, xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n", # ticks ann = FALSE, # labels + titles fg = rgb(0, 0, 0, 0), # surrounding box col = rgb(0, 0, 0, 0) # data points ) ``` ![A plot with everything removed](/images/blogs/create-empty-rplot_remove-everything.png) You are loking at an empty **white** image. ### Remove everything!? (Part 2) But wait, there's more. The image is still **white**. Lets plot a transparent one ðŸ˜Ž. ```{r} png( filename = "empty-Rplot.png", bg = rgb(0, 0, 0, 0) ) plot( x1, y1, xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n", # ticks ann = FALSE, # labels + titles fg = rgb(0, 0, 0, 0), # surrounding box col = rgb(0, 0, 0, 0) # data points ) dev.off() ``` **transparent** image below â†“ ![A plot with everything removed and a transparent background](/images/blogs/create-empty-rplot_empty-Rplot.png) You are loking at an empty **transparent** image â†‘. > Note: Not all image formats support transparent background, e.g. .jpg files
